item.description:
Report X-2025010569

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=283977671474 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1791 CLASS=80 QTY UOM=Liquid - Milliliter PSN TEXT=Hypochlorite solution PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1000 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=6 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1000 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Milliliter )Spill. Undeclared Hazmat (no labels/markings on outer pkg). Approx 40ml lost from 1 of 6x500ml bottles Siemens RD702 Probe cleaner, loose cap. 6x1000ml Siemens RD703 Probe cleaner also included. Packing list available in QR code under TRK ID.

item.title: Report E-2025010182
item.description:
Report E-2025010182

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 14, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately 8-ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025010181
item.description:
Report E-2025010181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails flipping over in the trailer and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and damaged container and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. Three (3) 5-gallon poly drums were also used to contain three additional jugs of product due to contamination. A total of five (5) 5-gallon poly drums of waste were generated from this spill. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On January 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was damaged and released approximately 40-gallons to the trailer floor, asphalt beneath the trailer, and further migrated to a storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. Absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate all impacted locations. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025010667
item.description:
Report X-2025010667

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BNSF personnel identified a potential release from the TILX 360231 while the car was in the Pasco Bowl Track 43. The car was isolated pending inspection by BNSF Hazmat personnel. Upon inspection, gasoline vapor was found emitting from the manway between the nozzle and hinged lid. The manway was opened and found that the gasket was misaligned and not sealing completely. The gasket was replaced with a nozzle gasket and the lid secured. A new seal was installed and the car was released. There were no identified ground impacts from the release and gasoline spilled on the car had evaporated. Estimated release volume is based upon responder observations.

  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it and the damaged pails into two (2) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USJ experienced a UN3267 35 High Mod LV- Part B release from (40) 2-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to multiple 6 x 6 areas of the wood trailer floor The pails were leaking from the seams of the lids, handles, and base due to defective packaging. All pails were containerized into (2) 85-gallon poly drums. The impacted areas were cleaned with absorbents which were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: HAMPSHIRE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from one (1) 275-gallon IBC poly tote due to a gash at the top of the tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010165
item.description:
Report E-2025010165

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-04
  • City: HAHNVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Saturday, January 4, 2025, a Occidental Chemical driver made a delivery of Hydrochloric Acid to the Occidental Chemical plant located in Hahnville, LA. The Occidental Chemical driver was loaded at an IMTT facility located in Geismar, LA. While the unloading process was underway, it was discovered that the bleeder valve on the product transfer line that goes to the product storage tank was left open. This resulted in approximately 2,500 gallons of Hydrochloric acid being released from the product line into the containment area. No injuries or exposure to chemical occurred as a result of this event, as well as no off-site impact or environmental impact. The offloading process was halted, bleeder valve closed, containment area drained to sump for processing, and remainder of offload was completed.

  • Description: The driver stopped to get fuel and when he was performing a walk around he noticed liquid dripping from the back of the trailer at 1130 et. The driver then put down som absorbent and called our emergency number. A team was dispatched to the truck stop and arrived around 1300 et. They found that one of the IBC flexible bags was leaking and began to repack them into a new container cleaning up any material with absorbents. The container was repacked and everything was cleaned up by 1500et and the driver was sent on his way.

item.title: Report E-2024120516
item.description:
Report E-2024120516

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: Oshkosh
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONVENIENCE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 67750
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Our vehicle was approaching a controlled intersection at 10 MPH. To our left, a vehicle (Class 5 or 6 pickup towing equipment) was turning onto the roadway. Conditions were wet and snowy, the other vehicle lost control. The other unit spun out and his trailer came around and hit our truck and tank. The other driver's trailer broke away from the pickup and lodged into the side of our tanker, thus resulting in a puncture to the middle compartment. The puncture is located about two thirds of the way down, in the middle compartment. Our driver maintained full control of his vehicle, stopped immediately, and initiated spill protocol. The road closure was to secure the accident scene and reopened upon vehicle removal. Pictures and reports are attached.

  • City: CARLISLE

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0231 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of Nitric Acid released from a metal drum due a packaging defect by the shipper. The release impacted the top of the drum only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of UN2031 Nitric Acid product released at top of the metal drum lid 24 area due to not being tighten enough. The contractors replaced the bung cap, and shake tested the drum and used absorbent rags to wipe up the spill, then containerized the impacted rags and a goosenecked bag of PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Railcar CTCX 135391 was hooked up and offloading, it was coupled to 1 of 4 residue last contained rail cars which were scheduled to be switched out. In between the residue last contained and the full cars that were coupled together, there was a derail and blue flag applied to the rail track. Railroad personnel (on site conductor from Seaview) didnt check to see if residue last contained cars were uncoupled from the full car (railroad procedure is for onsite conductor to verify that cars are uncoupled) and as such Seaview pulled the full car along with the residue last contained car. The full rail car also had a wheel chock on it. When the offloading (full) railcar was pulled, the bridge bent on rail tower and one liquid hose snapped off the pipe nipple. The railcar wheel went over top of derail and went over the wheel chock. The derail is designed to stop cars incoming but designed to stop from opposite direction (outgoing). One liquid hose snapped at fitting and propane released into air from the railcar and hose. This triggered the LEL detectors which initiated a shutdown, and all valves were closed. The hose released until nothing was left from end of valve to tip of hose. While the rail car was still releasing an operator climbed car and turned a valve on top of rail car at 3:30 pm. 3: 25 pm-start of incident. 3:30 pm-Site operator turned valve on top of railcar to stop release. 3:45 pm-- fire dept on site. No vapor cloud observed but did smell residual odor. 4:00 pm--Alex on site. Shortly after 4:00 pm RI Dept of Env Mgt arrived. DEM requested report to be filed with NRC. NRC report number 1418172. DEM contact was Jason Kasawa, 401-255-2910. 5:00 pm- The facility was cleared by fire dept to unhook railcar. Site personnel unhooked rail car and derailed it and closed it so Seaview could move it back on track. Fire dept requested the facility to lock process on damaged arm. 5:15 pm-Fire Dept returned control to facility. Estimated quantity: Less than 50 gallons. Estimate based on end of valve tip of hose (approx. 20 ft) 2 mins of release before valve was closed to railcar.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to Pilgrims Pride. He was filling the tank and was 450 gallons from the tank being full on the gaging system when it begin to overflow into containment. The driver was watching the offload and immediately shut down the transfer of materials. Approximately 20 gallons of Ferric Chloride Solution overflowed and 100% of it was contained in the containment at the site. There were no injuries or exposes during the release.

  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified on 11/23/2024 of a cell phone overheat event that occurred on 11/22/2024 during during the deplaning phase of flight(DL602). A passenger's cell phone overheated and a fire was observed. The customer used a beverage to extinguish the flame that immediately mitigated the event. The flight attendant was ready to use a fire extinguisher if needed. No injuries were reported. The crew initiated a gate evacuation via forward boarding door using same direction of deplaning. The NRC and FAA were notified. 1

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010104
item.description:
Report E-2025010104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced an over the road release of UN2693 VOxOUT 70C from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 60-gallons of product released to a 20 x 3 area of the trailer floor and a 30 x 3 area of the asphalt road below. The tote was damaged due to not being strapped down which caused it to load shift into the trailer wall. The material left in the damaged tote was transferred into a new one for shipment on. The impacted areas were then cleaned with absorbents and degreaser. All the impacted snow, absorbents, and debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into a cubic yard box. The waste was removed from the site for disposal.

  • Description: Operations Supervisor at 281 called Safety to report that a trailer arrived from 034 to 281 with a spill on it. The forklift operator that was about to unload the trailer advised that there was some cardboard covering a pallet of bags and when he moved the cardboard he discovered that at least one o f the bags was torn open and there was white powder all over. The operations supervisor advised that it looked like the bag was torn previously and someone had attempted to tape it over and cover it up. ~~Called CURA and spoke with Lizzie and advised we will need the crew to attempt to determine the cause of the damage.~~Lizzie with CURA advised that the crew discovered two damaged 50 lb bags of UN3262 which released 3 lbs of powder to the trailer floor due to a forklift strike.

item.title: Report X-2025010382
item.description:
Report X-2025010382

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF HAZMAT SPILL AT PENN 4 SPLIT 0530AM PST. HAZMAT RESPONDEDER DAWNED APPROPRIATE GEAR AND RESPONDED. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE REVEALED HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS WITH CORROSIVE DESIGNATION. PACKAGE OBSERVED WET ON TOP AND BOTTOM OF PACKAGING BOX. HAZMAT NOT SEEPING OUT OF SHIPPING CONTAINER. REMOVED HAZMAT FROM AREA NO SPILLAGE SEEN IN AREA. TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. OPENED PACKAGE AND OBSERVED CRACKED LID ON A 1 GALLON JUG. TESTED SOLUTION WITH A PH OF 11 PER COLOR CODED CHART. NEUTRALIZED HAZMAT USING SODIUM BICARBONATE IN ITS OWN PLASTIC CONTAINER. RETESTED SOLUTION 2 TIMES TO VERIFY A PH OF 6. USED A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH PLASTIC BAG AND ZEB ZORBENT AND WOODEN MIXING STICK TO SOLIDIFY SOLUTION. ONCE SOLIDIFIED PUT INITIAL PLASTIC BAG WITH SOLIDIFIED SOLUTION, GLOVES, STIRRING STICK, CARDBOARD PACKAGING, GLOVESS, AND PLASTIC JUG IN GREEN HAZMAT BAG. GOOSE NECKED BAG TAPED AND BEGAN HAZMAT PROCESSING.

  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the MEMH spill office. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal bucket in a plastic bag sealed with a zip tie and bubble wrap for dunnage. The lid of the bucket came open spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025010436
item.description:
Report X-2025010436

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELLED AS UN1824, SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION WITH A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE DIAMOND AND IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE INNER 3.6 LITER CONTAINERS. TWO CONTAINERS WERE ENTIRELY EMPTY. ONE CONTAINER WAS STILL INTACT AND NOT LEAKING. THE ENTIRE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING DISPOSAL PROCEDURES. THE PACKAGE HAD ALREADY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN INDIANAPOLIS ON 18-DECEMBER-2024 AND WAS TRAILERED TO MARYLAND WHERE THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED.

  • City: GRAYSVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 137170
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: CTMV was exiting I22 eastbound and upon negotiating the curve ran off the left side of the roadway causing his vehicle to rollover. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of material leaked from manway onto asphalt. Fire and police responded and closed access to the ramp for approximately 6 hours. Barrier was constructed around spill to prevent spread. Truck was uprighted and removed. Hazardous material was cleaned up by HazMat contractor and ramp reopened.

item.title: Report E-2025010107
item.description:
Report E-2025010107

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-29
  • City: GREEN RIVER
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GEMINI MOTOR TRANSPORT, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 29, 2024, at 1320 ET, Enviro Care personnel arrived on-site and conducted an initial assessment. They reported that an estimated 100 gallons of diesel fuel was released, affecting an area measuring 250 feet by 30 feet on the concrete slab. The fuel migrated into the parking lot, impacting a nearby drain basin. Enviro Care confirmed that no material flowed beyond the drain basin. The team then began operational procedures, which included pressure washing the affected asphalt. They used a vacuum truck to collect the rinse water and recover the impacted water from the drain basin. Enviro Care collected 359 gallons of diesel-impacted water and removed the waste from the site for pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010094
item.description:
Report E-2025010094

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured while loading other freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. An additional one (1) 85-gallon poly drum contains the punctured 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 6, 2025, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

No other packages were damaged. No injuries occurred during the spill.

  • Description: On January 3, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group, Inc. (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The impacted pallet was dismantled. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025010216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SATR location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. It contained six plastic bottles and one had a loose cap causing the release. The plastic bottles were packaged with packing paper for dunnage. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a SDS inside of the box stating the contents were UN1805. There were no DG markings or paperwork required for transport on the outer fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:40 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Q1 Enzian Blue Satin Urethane released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3115279. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 223391-1 was created, one 95-gallon poly drum containing one 5-gallon pale, oil dri, protective gloves, goggles, and plastic wrap. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024121300075 was given by Alex.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0419 ET, NCH notified ERTS of a cargo release located on their dock. It was reported 1 pound of lithium hydroxide released from 2 50-pound paper bags due to forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor be sent out due to being a hazard class 8. The caller reported the terminal will clean the release with PPE on site and place the spill along with the 2 damaged bags inside of a 55-gallon poly drum. Carechem was notified of the release and report #18879 was provided.

  • Description: At 19:35 EST on 12/12, Dan with XPO-XSB contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "ACTIVATOR" from 2x 5gal metal pails impacting the trailer and dock floors. The pails were punctured by a forklift at XSB. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor assist with additional PPE, citing goggles. Placed the (2) 5-gallon pails in 55-gallon metal drum and staged for terminal management to handle.

item.title: Report E-2025010083
item.description:
Report E-2025010083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1946 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at UVG. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Zep Acidic Toilet Bowl Cleaner released from 1-gallon plastic jugs due to improper loading by terminal UCU. The release impacted the inside of a small plastic carrier bin in trailer # 3213389. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Esther. Report #20241201200198. ERTS called Trenton back and he explained that the damaged box is by itself on the plastic carrier bin. He said the bin isn't something that they would need to salvage, and he has no problem disposing it. ERTS advised that since the product is contained to the bin, terminal personnel can place the bin in a 55-gallon poly waste drum themselves.

item.title: Report E-2025010091
item.description:
Report E-2025010091

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-08
  • City: GILSON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroMark was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the trailer floor and 20ft-by-2ft of the soil beyond the shoulder and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to a single vehicle accident that resulted in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroMark personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the recovered material into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum and two other impacted drums were overpacked into three (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
